sentence.text: Here, we show that high levels of the actin cytoskeleton-associated protein actin cortical patch assembly (WASP-interacting protein) correlates with tumor growth, both of which are linked to the tumor-initiating cell phenotype.

We cellular response to interleukin-4 that actin cortical patch assembly controls tumor growth by boosting signals that stabilize the YAP/TAZ complex via a mechanism mediated by the endocytic/endosomal system.
This close biochemical relationship indicates an oncogenic role for actin cortical patch assembly in the physiology of cancer pathology by increasing YAP/TAZ stability
